Increasing Success

Coupa | Lead Design | 2022

As the sole lead designer, I partnered with a senior VP product manager and development team to revamp Coupa‘s onboarding process. The critical issue I addressed was customer profile info fragmented across multiple domains, completed by different users. This redesign boosted onboarding success by 50%, enhancing the $43 billion in transaction value already enabled by Coupa for diverse suppliers.

User Research

The onboarding process required info on business, financial, shipping, banking, identity, and diversity.

Our key finding was that most businesses needed input from several people or departments to complete onboarding. Once left incomplete, missing information was often never provided.

Challenges and Solutions

  • My initial instinct was to simplify by removing questions, but all were essential for business.
  • We couldn‘t let one question block progress, so I enabled users to skip steps.
  • I designed a method to forward unanswered questions to colleagues.

Workflow

The complex workflow allowed different paths based on user responses.

Iterations

Multiple iterations of the onboarding panel design included images, large buttons, or progress indicators. We ultimately rejected images (user feedback) and progress indicators (impracticality).

Skip

A ‘Skip‘ link below the Next button opens a menu to skip or forward to a colleague. Forwarding triggers a message in the user‘s default email client.

Forward using your own email client

Forwarding opens a message in the user‘s default email client. The email refers to the sender's name, phone number and the client's company name, all gathered from profile data.

I developed sample code for a mailto link as proof of concept.

Forward to a colleague

This solution contributed to a 50% improvement in onboarding success, supporting $43 billion in value for diverse suppliers.
